DOC.brief_summary: Initial study in children with epilepsy to evaluate the pharmacokinetics, safety, tolerability and preliminary efficacy of adjunctive treatment with brivaracetam, and to develop dosing adaptations for future studies.
DOC.brief_title: Open-label, Pharmacokinetic, Safety and Efficacy Study of Adjunctive Brivaracetam in Children With Epilepsy.
DOC.criteria: Clinical diagnosis of epilepsy Subject having at least 1 seizure (any type) during the 3 weeks before first visit Stable dosing of 13 concomitant antiepileptic drugs Pregnant or nursing females Concomitant use of Levetiracetam Epilepsy secondary to a Progressive cerebral disease/tumor or other neurodegenerative disease History of status epilepticus Clinically significant acute or chronic illness, underlying disease or medication condition History of suicide attempt
